item.description:
this is an event in conjuction with Queeche VT as it's only about 40 to 45 min Drive away and can hit both locations...

Link: Saint-Gaudens National Historic Site

Directions:
From western Massachusetts and points south, take Route I 91 North to Exit 8 (Ascutney). Bear right, proceed through the traffic light and across the Connecticut River. At next light, turn left onto NH Route 12A and go north about 8 miles (10 minutes). Saint-Gaudens Road will be on the right 1.5 miles past the Cornish-Windsor covered bridge. Proceed up Saint-Gaudens Road .5 miles. The parking lot will be on your right.

Hours of Operation and Season:

The park will reopen for the season on Saturday, May 26, 2007. The exhibit buildings will be open daily, 9:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., from May 26 through October 31, 2007. From November 1, 2006, through May 25, 2007, only the grounds are open and an entrance fee is not charged.

The grounds may be accessed from 8:00 a.m. until dusk, year-round. During the winter months, most areas of the park are not maintained for public use. Visitors should take care as pathways may be snow covered and slippery.

Fees:
An entrance fee of $5.00 per person is charged for visitors age 16 and over. The receipt is valid for seven days and may be used for re-entry to the park.

this is a nice way to fill in time between the Morning and Evening Launches at the Queeche VT Balloon Festival

any questions plz feel free to contact me

thnx,
~Will
item.name: Saint-Gaudens National Historic Site
